intro: Leptocladia microheliopsis, commonly known as the small helix liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Marchaliaceae. It is a non-vascular plant characterized by its simple, thalloid structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant exhibits a distinctive spiral arrangement of its leaf-like structures, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in humid climates and is often seen growing on rocks or soil in forest understories. Leptocladia microheliopsis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
